1{-# LANGUAGE FlexibleContexts #-}
2{-# LANGUAGE OverloadedStrings #-}
3{-# LANGUAGE ViewPatterns #-}
4{-# OPTIONS_GHC -Wall #-}
5
6-- | Text lines delimited by carriage returns or line feeds.
7
8module Koshucode.Baala.Base.Code.Line
9  ( -- * Line
10    LineNumber,
11    NumberedLine,
12    dropBom,
13    bzLines,
14    numberedLines,
15    linesCrlf, linesCrlfBz, linesCrlfNumbered,
16
17    -- * CodeLine
18    CodeLine (..),
19    IndentSize,
20    lineIndentPair,
21  ) where
22
23import qualified Data.ByteString.Lazy                 as Bz
24import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Overture             as O
25import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Base.Abort           as B
26import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Base.IO              as B
27
28
29-- ----------------------  Line
30
31-- | Line number.
32type LineNumber = Int
33
34-- | Line with number.
35type NumberedLine t = (LineNumber, t)
36
37-- | Create numbered lines from lazy bytestring.
38numberedLines :: (B.ToCode code, O.Textual t) => code -> [NumberedLine t]
39numberedLines = zip [1..] . textualLines
40
41-- | Create textual lines from lazy bytestring.
42textualLines :: (B.ToCode code, O.Textual t) => code -> [t]
43textualLines = map O.bzT . bzLines . B.toCode
44
45-- | Split lazy bytestring by newline character sequence.
46--   If bytestring begins with the UTF-8 BOM, this function drops it.
47bzLines :: O.Bz -> [O.Bz]
48bzLines = loop . dropBom where
49    loop bz | Bz.null bz  = []
50            | otherwise   = case Bz.break crlf bz of
51                              (ln, bz') -> ln : loop (strip bz')
52                          
53    crlf n = (n == lf) || (n == cr)
54    lf     = 10 -- '\n'
55    cr     = 13 -- '\r'
56
57    strip bz2@(Bz.uncons -> Just (c , bz2'))
58               | c == cr   = strip bz2'
59               | c == lf   = bz2'
60               | otherwise = bz2
61    strip bz2 = bz2
62                  
63-- | Remove UTF-8 BOM (EF BB BF in hexadecimal) from lazy bytestring.
64--
65--   >>> dropBom "\xEF\xBB\xBF|foo bar baz"
66--   "|foo bar baz"
67--
68--   >>> dropBom "\xEF|foo bar baz"
69--   "\239|foo bar baz"
70--
71dropBom :: O.Bz -> O.Bz
72dropBom bz = case Bz.splitAt 3 bz of
73               (bom, body) | "\xEF\xBB\xBF" == bom -> body
74                           | otherwise             -> bz
75
76-- | Split string into lines.
77--   The result strings do not contain
78--   carriage returns (@\\r@)
79--   and line feeds (@\\n@).
80--
81--   >>> linesCrlf "aaa\nbbb\r\nccc\n\nddd\n"
82--   ["aaa","bbb","ccc","","ddd"]
83--
84{-# DEPRECATED linesCrlf "Consider 'bzLines'." #-}
85linesCrlf :: String -> [String]
86linesCrlf s
87    | O.tIsEmpty s = []
88    | otherwise = ln : next s2
89    where
90      (ln, s2) = break (`elem` ("\r\n" :: String)) s
91      next (O.tCut -> O.Jp '\r' s3) = next s3
92      next (O.tCut -> O.Jp '\n' s3) = linesCrlf s3
93      next s3                       = linesCrlf s3
94
95-- | Line number and its content.
96{-# DEPRECATED linesCrlfNumbered "Consider 'bzLines'." #-}
97linesCrlfNumbered :: String -> [NumberedLine String]
98linesCrlfNumbered = zip [1..] . linesCrlf
99
100-- | Split lazy bytestring by newline character sequence.
101--   This function drops the BOM sequence.
102{-# DEPRECATED linesCrlfBz "Consider 'bzLines'." #-}
103linesCrlfBz :: (B.ToCode code) => code -> [O.Bz]
104linesCrlfBz = bzLines . B.toCode
105
106
107-- ----------------------  CodeLine
108
109-- | Tokens in line.
110data CodeLine k t = CodeLine
111    { lineNumber  :: LineNumber    -- ^ Line number, from 1.
112    , lineContent :: t             -- ^ Line content without newline.
113    , lineTokens  :: [k t]         -- ^ Tokens in the line.
114    } deriving (Show, Eq, Ord)
115
116instance (B.GetCodePos (k t)) => B.GetCodePos (CodeLine k t) where
117    getCPs (CodeLine _ _ toks) = B.getCPs toks
118
119-- | Type for indent size.
120type IndentSize = Int
121
122-- | Calculate indent of line and pairing it.
123lineIndentPair :: (k t -> IndentSize) -> CodeLine k t -> (IndentSize, CodeLine k t)
124lineIndentPair ind ln@(CodeLine _ _ (tk : _)) = (ind tk, ln)
125lineIndentPair _   ln@(CodeLine _ _ [])       = (0, ln)
126
